data.event: The name was adopted in 1918 as a place name for Crown lands north of Coolangatta.
After the land sales, a rail siding was created in 1919.

event.title: 1919, the catalyst for an increase in development was said

data.event: After 1919, the catalyst for an increase in development was said to be the erection of a general store, owned by businessman Percy Hanzel, near the rail siding.

event.title: the establishment of the Bilinga Surf Lifesaving Club in 1938

data.event: The drowning of a man on Bilinga Beach in 1937 lead to the establishment of the Bilinga Surf Lifesaving Club in 1938.
In the 2011 census, Bilinga recorded a population of 1,662 people, 48.9% female and 51.1% male.
